"
ListContent1:
"
  • Build automation tools for provisioning and managing our cloud infrastructure by leveraging the AWS API for EC2, S3, CloudFront, RDS and Route53 amongst others
  • Contribute to enhancing and managing our continuous delivery pipeline
  • Proactively seek out opportunities to improve monitoring and alerting of our hosts and services, and implement them in a timely fashion
  • Code scripts and tools to collect and visualize metrics from linux hosts and JVM applications
  • Enhance and maintain our logs collection, processing and visualization infrastructure
  • Automate systems configuration by writing policies and modules for configuration management tools
  • Write both frontend (html/css/js) and backend code (Python, Ruby, Perl)
  • Troubleshoot and fix production outages and performance issues in our AWS/Linux infrastructure stack
  • Participate in periodic oncall rotations for devops
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this Role?
ListContent2:
"
  • Should have been with the current team for at least 15 months. Exceptions can be made if the reporting Manager is of the opinion that the individual’s strengths will be utilized more effectively in a different team.
  • Should have a consistently good track record of performance (based on regular internal and customer feedback, performance measurement on key performance indicators of the current role).
  • DevOps/System Admin experience ranging between 4+ years
  • In depth Linux/Unix knowledge, good understanding the various linux kernel subsystems (memory, storage, network etc)
  • DNS, TCP/IP, Routing, HA & Load Balancing
  • Configuration management using tools like CFEngine, Puppet or Chef
  • SQL and NoSQL databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB and HBase
  • Build and packaging tools like Jenkins and RPM/Yum
  • HA and Load balancing using tools like the Elastic Load Balancer and HAProxy
  • Monitoring tools like Nagios, Pingdom or similar
  • Log management tools like logstash, fluentd, syslog, elasticsearch or similar
  • Metrics collection tools like Ganglia, Graphite, OpenTSDB or similar
  • Programming in a high level language like Python or Ruby
"

Followers: "Suman Prakash Das, Janushi Saumil Shah, Poppin Mathias"
Description:
"We are looking for a dynamic and passionate leader to grow and steer the global business operations, strategy and business development initiatives for one of our leading brands (domain endings) - .STORE Domains.

.STORE Domains was launched in June 2016 and since then has seen positive acceptance from the global retail and ecommerce community. There are over 185K domains registered across the globe with top-notch brands, influencers and musicians such as Emirates (www.emirates.store), Lorde (www.lorde.store), Khalid (www.khalid.store) and also thousands of retailers using .STORE for their online presence.

As Brand Manager your goal will be to make sure that your domain extension becomes the preferred choice for your target audience worldwide. You will be managing growth  while keeping a keen eye on financial health, brand awareness, consumer adoption and profitability of the brand. 
"
ListContent1:
"
  • P&L Management: You will be responsible for owning and driving the P&L for .STORE.
  • Strategy and Marketing: You will head the vision, strategy and implementation of marketing and business development activities for . STORE. Activities will include online and offline sales and marketing initiatives such as: direct marketing, events & conferences, strategic partnerships with the retail ecosystem, online marketing, social media, PR, viral marketing etc.
  • Growth Management: You will build and execute a growth driven strategy to achieve market dominance in the extremely competitive market for new gTLDs.
  • Channel Management: You will actively partner with the channel sales team to develop strong partnerships with registrars (distributors) worldwide to grow the business' topline.
  • People Management: You will identify, recruit and manage an effective and passionate team of high-caliber individuals in order to effectively achieve business objectives.
  • You will be hands on and involved in both the breadth and depth for all of the above functions and tasks.
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent2:
"
  • Should have been with the current team for at least 15 months. Exceptions can be made if the reporting Manager is of the opinion that the individual’s strengths will be utilized more effectively in a different team.
  • Should have a consistently good track record of performance (based on regular internal and customer feedback, performance measurement on key performance indicators of the current role).
  • Should be a seasoned strategy and marketing professional with over 5 years of overall experience, of which at least 3 years have been spent in leading marketing initiatives preferably in the Internet industry.
  • In addition to being Web 2.0 savy, is also proficient in field of online marketing.
  • Should be an astute strategist - possess the natural ability to sense opportunity and focus on key differentiators.
  • Should be a hustler who is target-driven, extremely motivated and does not stop until results are achieved.
  • Has immaculate written and oral communication skills.
  • Has a strong career trajectory.
  • Preferably, has a MBA from a Tier 1 Business School.
"

Description:
"Radix is an internet company with a large partner network; some of our global partners include GoDaddy, Google, BigRock, Zoho, etc. These channel partners contribute to 95% + of the revenue made by Radix. We are looking for a marketing maven to help us lead all marketing efforts targeted to these 200+ partners spread across the globe.  

As a Channel Marketing Manager, your goal will be to build and maintain high recall for Radix and all its domain endings portfolio amongst these partners. You will be the creator & custodian of all marketing and communication targeted to the channel, both online and offline.

You will be responsible for building & executing strategy for all aspects of Channel Marketing -  Events, Online Marketing, Content Creation, ROI measurement, PR & Social Media.
"
ListContent1:
"
  • Content & Communications:
  • Creating a PR strategy targeting the channel & working with the content team to execute it.
  • Leading Partner Communications i.e. creation and distribution of - emails, monthly newsletters, presentations, infographics, white papers, event collaterals etc.
  • Support the channel team with presentations and data needed to make compelling pitches for Radix and its domain extensions.

  • Online Marketing:
  • Creating an annual calendar for Online Marketing Campaigns.
  • Ideating & driving execution of each of these by working with the design & web development teams.
  • Monitoring the impact of these campaigns with the online marketing team & recommending newer avenues or strategies that can be looked at.

  • Events:
  • Building the yearly event calendar & working to finalize budgets, sponsorships for each of these events. Suggesting  unique out of the box sponsorship opportunities.
  • Driving planning & communication with clients to co-partner/co-sponsor events, conferences, when required.
  • Working with the Events team to plan exciting social events & get-togethers for Partners.

  • Annual Planning, Budgeting & ROI Measurement:
  • Creating an annual marketing plan and budget. Ensuring all marketing activities are within the scope of the same.
  • Brainstorming and ideation of  new marketing initiatives that can be rolled out across the channel.
  • Creating & making quarterly presentations to review marketing activities and spends.
  • Closely monitoring ROI on investments made with channel partners.
  • Working with management to ensure deadlines & budgets are met every single time.
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent2:
"
  • Should have been with the current team for at least 15 months. Exceptions can be made if the reporting Manager is of the opinion that the individual’s strengths will be utilized more effectively in a different team.
  • Should have a consistently good track record of performance (based on regular internal and customer feedback, performance measurement on key performance indicators of the current role).
  • Experience:  
  • Should be a seasoned marketing professional with  3.6 - 8 yrs of marketing experience.
  • Experience in B2B/Partner Marketing or the Domain Industry is preferred but not necessary.

  • Skills:
  • Possesses strong marketing acumen.
  • Has very strong writing and communication skills.
  • Basic understanding of visual communication and marketing media.
  • Exceptional organization and planning skills.
  • Must be good at managing multiple activities & projects simultaneously.
  • Keen eye to detail.
  • Be a go-getter and has a can-do attitude.
  • Be a people's person and can use the gift of gab to get out of tricky situations.
"

ListContent1:
"
  • Positioned as the new ""moniker"" for the technology industry, .TECH has received positive feedback from various target groups in the technology sector - startups, developers, bloggers, universities, tech clubs, brands etc.
  • The candidate applying to the role of the Marketing Specialist is expected to work with the Brand manager to hustle through and take the "".TECH journey"" to the next level.

Marketing & Brand Management:
  • Ideate and create hard hitting and relatable campaigns for various target segments for online, social, influencer and offline media
  • Work with Content Marketing teams to identify potential stories, platforms and distribution partners
  • Spearhead sponsorships and activations for global developer and startup centric events & conferences

Partnerships:
  • Identify and activate strategic alliances and integrations
  • Identify and activate Influencer campaigns

Planning and Reporting:
  • Work on creating annual and quarterly marketing plans
  • Assist the Brand Manager in monthly, quarterly and annual reporting and process improvements
  • Internal analysis on campaign performance

Project Management & Operations
  • Work closely with the content, design, web development and marketing teams to ensure timelines are met and quality standards maintained
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent2:
"
  • Should have been with the current team for at least 15 months. Exceptions can be made if the reporting Manager is of the opinion that the individual’s strengths will be utilized more effectively in a different team.
  • Should have a consistently good track record of performance (based on regular internal and customer feedback, performance measurement on key performance indicators of the current role).
  • 2-5 years experience in a marketing role
  • Agency experience is a plus
  • Ability to work in a highly dynamic environment
  • Exceptional organization and planning skills
  • Exceptional written/verbal communication
  • A penchant for understanding consumer traits and behavior
  • Keen eye to detail
  • Basic understanding of visual communication and marketing media
"

ListTitle1: What is the job is like?
ListContent1:
"
  • Specialize in graphic design with up to date knowledge of industry leading software and technologies
  • Collaborate internally with marketing team as well as with respective brand managers to conceptualize and execute creative solutions that can be translated across various media platforms
  • Understand brand aesthetics and effectively adapting it to different media
  • Understand the client brief and explore smart ways of delivering communication
  • Create and develop new design concepts, brand guidelines, print collaterals, social media campaigns, presentations, and infographics etc
  • Have an eye for detail with knowledge of typography, color and layout
  • Assist in the planning and execution of creative process, look into pre and post production quality checks and should have the ability to work in a highly collaborative environment
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent2:
"
  • Should have been with the current team for at least 15 months. Exceptions can be made if the reporting Manager is of the opinion that the individual’s strengths will be utilized more effectively in a different team.
  • Should have a consistently good track record of performance (based on regular internal and customer feedback, performance measurement on key performance indicators of the current role).
  • 2-3 years work experience with a strong portfolio of work
  • Preferably with a design school background
  • Must have knowledge in UI design and basics of motion graphics can be an add on
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills is a mustStrong creative, organizational, problem solving and time-management skills
  • Ability to take charge of projects independently with minimal supervision
  • Able to work under pressure with fast turnaround times
"

Followers: "Nishant Das, Shwetha Quinita Dsouza, Janushi Saumil Shah"
ListContent1:
"
  • As a Talent Acquisition Specialist, you will work with a team of seasoned talent scouts to identify and onboard ""A"" players for our expanding team across our multiple offices and functions. 
  • You will devise and execute creative recruitment strategies for continuing this growth pace while maintaining our high standards of quality.
  • You will be responsible for the entire life-cycle of tech recruitment at Flock, including strategy, sourcing, short-listing, pitching, communication, coordination, scheduling and negotiation.
  • You will be required to execute myriad sourcing strategies conventional and unconventional, online and offline, and will have the creative license to adopt any approach as long as it is within the confines of our value system.
  • You will be our brand ambassador, and evangelize Flock to potential candidates.
  • Coordinate with respective functional heads to define recruitment requirements, job specifications, interview processes, prepare budgets and plans
  •  Develop proactive sourcing strategies to engage and nurture a pipeline of passive talent
  • Define and implement creative sourcing strategies to source 'A' players from colleges, workplaces, databases
  • Define and implement creative marketing strategies and campaigns to attract top talent from the industry.
  • Define and implement sourcing, pitching and recruitment processes
  • Manage recruitment lifecycle for various tech posts
  • Ideate and create relevant material for marketing Flock and our businesses to potential candidates
  • Maximize ROI on recruitment costs and increase recruitment efficiencies.
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this Role?
ListContent2:
"
  • You should have 4- 8 years of experience in recruitment.
  • You have experience working with Tech/Product companies/startups.
  • You (preferably) have a relevant post graduate degree (MBA/Masters in an HR discipline)
  • You have exceptional communication skills - written and spoken
  • Considerable experience with myriad sourcing strategies including portals, ads, consultants, social networking, conferences, headhunting etc
  • Demonstrable creativity with respect to sourcing candidates
  • Experience in sourcing, pitching and recruiting for mid management and senior management positions
  • Well versed with technology and associated jargon. Ability to discuss technology to a limited extent as required by the profile.
  • Ability to grasp and deliver an excellent pitch to potential candidates
  • Keen sense of searching for and identifying exceptionally talented candidates
  • Experience with using new age media such as social network, linkedin, blogs etc
  • Experience in defining and implementing online marketing campaigns through social media, search marketing etc
  • Process oriented: Demonstrable commitment to defining, documenting and following processes and workflows
"

Description:
"As a Campus Operations Associate, you will be supporting a team of seasoned Talent Scouts to help with managing the overall candidate experience, in partnership with the campus recruiters and hiring managers to provide a world class experience to our candidates. 
"
ListContent1:
"
  • Work closely with Hiring Managers and Business Heads to get hiring projections for the year and help with building a focused and targeted campus strategy.
  • To manage and oversee allocation of campus hires based on the listed projections.
  • Take full ownership of managing all offered candidates post every campus hiring event
  • Manage the pre- onboarding process for all offered candidates including but not limited to preparing offer letters, assisting them with documentation, coordinating with IT to set up systems, administering background checks and supporting HR Advisors with weekly inductions to ensure a positive onboarding experience.
  • To be a point of contact for candidate inquiries on follow-ups on salary, role & location allocation, onboarding, travel coordination, offer letters etc.
  • Ensure compliance for every step in the recruitment operations lifecycle.
  • Maintain accuracy of all campus and candidate details on our applicant tracking system and trackers.
  • Ensure monitoring and managing campus expenses.
  • Build and maintain the campus database and generate reports for the team to identify shortcomings and suggest process recommendations to achieve operational excellence.
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this Role?
ListContent2:
"
  • Graduate in any stream.
  • Has 6 months- 2 years of experience in HR or Recruitment operations.
  • Should be open to travelling for campus events.
  • Strong inclination towards attention to detail. So, obsession with perfection is always welcome.
  • Well-spoken and eloquent in emails. Should understand how stressful a job hunt can be for a candidate and reflect the same in all communications that go out.
  • Flexible, fearless, and excited to build bigger and better processes for the team.
  • Knowledge of using MS Excel or zeal to learn and pick it up quickly.
"

Description:
"Created to hire Suraj Sharma, offer in progress. 
"

Description:
"About Flock
Flock is an enterprise messaging and collaboration app. At Flock we believe that synchronous messaging tools, supported with internal and external applications, have the power to smash organisational hierarchies, breakdown silos in the workplace, help companies better capture innovative ideas, support individuals in making faster decisions, and also bring more personable communication style into the workplace.
 
With 30,000 businesses already using the platform we know that we are onto something big, and are now gearing up for a period of rapid growth.

Flock is founded by Bhavin Turakhia. Serial entrepreneur and billionaire, Bhavin Turakhia is driven by a passion for problem-solving and maximizing efficiency through technology driven innovations. In the last 22 years, he has built 5 successful businesses, all driven by his belief that “it is our moral obligation to make an impact that is proportionate to our potential”. At 17, he co-founded Resellerclub, Logicboxes and BigRock, which he exited in a $160mn transaction in 2014. He is presently heading Flock - a suite of productivity apps, Zeta - a digital payments platform, and Radix - a leading registry for top-level extensions.

Role Overview
Flock is seeking an experienced Software Engineer to join the Platform Team. The Platform team is responsible for building and managing large distributed components that run Flock. We handle everything from Core Messaging Infrastructure, Messaging Storage, Flock platform to Analytics. We are looking for engineers who are passionate about solving complex problems and building platforms at scale.
"

Benefits and Perks
We at Flock love our jobs. And it’s no surprise – we get to work on exciting, new projects with some of the best brains in the industry, and that too in a vibrant atmosphere that is designed to be comfortable and conducive for our personal and professional growth.

And Flock goes the extra mile to make you feel at home. We offer benefits ranging from affordable catered meals and even snacks on the house. Our workspaces are welcoming and fun, complete with bean bag chairs and ping pong tables. You are free to wear what makes you comfortable and choose the hours you keep, as a team. Oh, and we’ve got your family covered too, with great health insurance plans and other benefits. In short, everything you need to be your best self at work!

We are passionate about helping teams move to the next level of communication and collaboration, and believe that happy employees are key to achieving this goal. If you like the idea of working on cutting-edge technologies and solutions that have a truly global impact, get in touch!
"
ListContent1:
"
  • Design and develop large scale distributed services
  • Design and implement new user-facing features
  • Take ownership of one or more components of the platform and drive innovation in your area of ownership
  • Analyze and improve the efficiency, scalability, stability, and security of the platform as a whole
  • Work closely with product management and UX design teams to define and refine feature specifications
  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
  • Participate actively in recruitment and nurturing of engineers as awesome as you
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this Role?
ListContent2:
"
  • Solid foundation in computer science with strong competency in data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Java expert. Experience with golang, python or other languages is a plus
  • Good understanding of nuances of distributed systems, scalability and availability
  • Good knowledge of one or more relational and NoSQL databases and transactions
  • In-depth understanding of concurrency, synchronization, NIO, memory allocation and GC
  • Experience with IaaS clouds like AWS/Google Cloud, Azure, OpenStack etc
  • Experience in a startup environment is a plus
  • Good communication skills. Putting your thoughts through to other stakeholders in a cohesive manner is not a problem for you.
"

Followers: "Deepika Joshi, Anita Ramachandran, Catherine Solomon, Mittal Nagda"
ListContent1:
"
  • Understand the business and its stakeholders
  • On-board new joiners and ensuring they have a WOW day 1 experience including facilitation sessions, documentation etc
  • Catch up with new joiners to get 30-60-90 day feedback and suggest improvements basis the feedback
  • Manage performance review cycles along with the HRBP
  • Analyse feedback for the current process and identifying gaps in the process and suggesting interventions to bridge the gaps
  • Make process recommendations to achieve operational excellence basis research on industry best practices
  • Know the pulse on the floor and identify engaging and fun activities for teams including celebrations, employee connect meetings, cultural events etc
  • Be the go-to person for employee queries on HR policies/processes
  • Manage employee separation process which includes - Conducting exit interviews, updating records, sending out mails for clearances, explaining the process, handing over letters, processing EDP and ensuring exit feedback gets reviewed by HRBP and is sent to the employee’s manager within the specified TAT
  • Provide assistance to Business Partner’s in routine activities and HR projects
  • Handle all miscellaneous HR operations for Radix, Codechef and Shared Teams
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent2:
"
  • You have 1-3 years of experience
  • You have excellent communication skills
  • You have excellent relationship building skills
  • You are smart, driven and energetic
  • You are good at creating compelling and (sometimes) elaborate content
  • Passionate about HR as a function and its deliverable
  • You are a natural at building relationships/rapport
  • Pro at troubleshooting, able to navigate your way out of an unknown problem
  • Love people operations
  • You have a keen eye for detail
  • You have the ability to think ‘out of the box’
  • You are proficient in MS Excel
  • You are able to deliver under tight deadlines and can effectively multi task.
"

ListContent1:
"
  • Partner with Flock's leadership team and support in driving organizational design, workforce planning, succession planning, and skills assessment and development.
  • Work towards conceptualizing and implementing organization structuring interventions and role based organizations to streamline career progression.
  • Partner and drive performance reviews, compensation planning along with business.
  • Lead the assessment practice, program manage key assessment interventions such as the Performance Management Process, Multi-Rater Process to create a high performance culture.
  • Design and implement best-in-class assessment and development practices to nurture top talent.
  • Program manage automation of performance assessment processes to enable an Integrated Talent management platform in the organization.
  • Design and promote competency based talent management.
  • Analyse trends in employee turnover, employee engagement surveys, pulse sessions and recommend interventions backed by data.
  • Develop and monitor informative HR dashboards to track key metrics for HR operations for continuous improvement.
  • Collaborate with all business units to address employee issues proactively.
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent2:
"
  • 4+ years of relevant experience as a HR Business Partner with strong exposure to Organisational Development projects.
  • MBA HR from a reputed Business School is highly preferable.
  • While you have a strong understanding of the principles of organization design, you are able to apply them in a pragmatic way that is understood and can be applied by our functional leads and HR business partners.
  • You possess strong analytical and problem solving skills with ability to organize and analyze data.
  • You have strong business acumen, excellent communication/influencing skills, change management skills, and planning/project management skills.
  • You have the ability to establish strong relationships at all levels throughout the organization.
  • You are confident, creative, proactive in taking initiatives and achieving them.
  • You are goal-oriented thrive in a fast-paced environment and are great at driving projects to completion with a strong attention to detail.
  • You have good knowledge of industry best practices and benefits.
"

Description:
"We are looking for a dynamic and passionate leader to grow and steer the global business operations, strategy and business development initiatives for a top level domain (TLD) brand. As Brand Manager, your goal will be to make sure that the TLD becomes the domain name of choice for the target audience worldwide. You will be managing growth while keeping a keen eye on visibility, consumer adoption and profitability. 

The responsibilities for this position include: 

P&L Management: You will be responsible for owning and driving the P&L for the TLD
Strategy and Marketing: You will head the vision, strategy and implementation of marketing and business development activities for the TLD. Activities will include online and offline sales and marketing initiatives such as: direct marketing, events & conferences, strategic partnerships, online marketing, social media, PR, viral marketing etc.
Growth Management: You will build and execute a growth driven strategy to achieve market dominance in the extremely competitive market for new gTLDs
Channel Management: You will actively partner with the channel sales team to develop strong partnerships with registrars (distributors) worldwide. 
People Management: You will identify, recruit and manage an effective and passionate team of high-calibre individuals in order to effectively achieve business objectives
You will be hands on and involved in both the breadth and depth for all of the above functions and tasks. 
"
Additional:
"Who should apply for this role?

* Is a seasoned strategy / marketing / sales professional with 4-10 years of overall experience, of which at least 3 years have been spent in leading business development and/or marketing initiatives, preferably in the Internet industry
* In addition to being Web 2.0 savvy, is also proficient in the field of online marketing
* Is an astute strategist - possesses the natural ability to sense opportunity and focus on key differentiators
* Possesses strong entrepreneurial spirit, strong business acumen and leadership potential
* Possesses strong project and people management skills
* Is target-driven, extremely motivated and does not stop until results are achieved
* Has immaculate written and oral communication skills
* Has a strong career trajectory
"

Followers: "Deepika Joshi, Sampath Mallikarjunan, Benjamin David Pointing, Nishant Das"
Description:
"About Flock

Flock is founded by Bhavin Turakhia. Bhavin has also been the Founder / Co-Founder of Directi( Linkedin's top companies, 2018), Radix, Ringo, Codechef and Zeta. These businesses comprise of 1500+ people, 8+ offices, 10+ million customers, revenues over $250+ million and a group enterprise value of over $1.4 billion.

Flock is an enterprise messaging and collaboration app that aims at increasing productivity and improving team-communication in organizations of all shapes and sizes. At Flock, we believe that enterprise communication should be richer and efficient. With that goal, we have developed and deployed an outstanding suite of products that enhances workplace communication and productivity.

Flock’s feature set includes:
- Secure one on one chat/ Group chat
- Video conferencing
- Audio Conferencing
- Process Automation - Real time business process and workflow automation
- Mailing lists… and much more

With teams at companies like Avendus, Gini and Jony, 1mg, Voonik, Yepme and Healthkart improving their workplace collaboration using Flock, we are already helping teams have richer and more efficient communication around the globe.


"

"
ListTitle1: What will your day be like?
ListContent1:
"
  • Flock is aggressively investing in inbound marketing in order to support its growth plans. This role will be right at the heart those growth plans. With broad ranging access to employees at all levels of the business (including the c-suite), the successful candidate will have the unique opportunity to interview/work with all key decision makers in the business with the view to creating engaging content.

On a day-to-day basis you would be:

  • Meeting with key decision makers throughout the company to understand their priorities and more specifically their decision making process
  • Using the information obtained from these interactions to produce content for publication
  • Supporting the broader content team to produce and review other forms of content
  • Becoming the internal champion of the ‘Flock way’; a thought leadership series designed to shed light on all of Flock’s best practices and learning

"
ListTitle2: Role goal
ListContent2:
"
  • We know that we have some great ideas, but we need your help to share them with the world.

In this role you will be responsible for:
  • Clearly understanding the processes by which business decisions are made
  • Synthesizing this information into compelling content
  • Developing a thought leadership series of blogs/articles
  • Ultimately the success of the role will be determined by the quality of the content produced.
"
ListContent3:
"
  • Generate, assign, and edit stories, features, news stories, prescriptive pieces, and franchises for Flock editorial properties
  • Interview internal and external parties for source material
  • Read widely on the enterprise communication and collaboration space to understand the latest trends
  • We’re a lean, fast-growing team, so this person will help with operations to ensure smooth team functioning as we expand. The role will also collaborate with other members of the Product, Design, Tech, Sales & Marketing and Support Teams
  • He or she will help refine our editorial brand voice and guidelines and work on strategic editorial initiatives like a newsletter, multi-channel editorial packages, and new products
  • The right candidate will bring an entrepreneurial approach to the role of a natural networker and self-starter, and a high level of comfort with navigating personalities and team dynamics in a fast-moving and fluid environment
  • The role demands creativity and big ideas, energy, dynamism, and a positive attitude. He or she must be an excellent writer and editor, highly organized and detail oriented, with strong time management, leadership, and collaboration skills
  • Helm cross-functional editorial projects and initiatives. Write a compelling display copy and the occasional story when the opportunity arises
"
ListContent4:
"
  • Curious - you will need to have a natural sense of curiosity. When a business decision is made do you want to know how/why or do you just accept it as ‘obvious’? If the later, then this is not the role for you
  • You are a great listener. In fact, you are so good at listening that you can hear what people mean, rather than what they say. The unique/hardwon insights of leaders at Flock will not always come fully formed - you will have to listen carefully to understand where the unique value is
  • Self-motivated - we are a start-up - not all processes are in place. On occasion you will have to drive initiatives forward without all of the desired infrastructure in place to support you
  • Be interested in technology and specifically the communication and collaboration space
"
ListContent5:
• Proven experience as managing editor/writer/reporter
  • Exceptional ability in copywriting and editing
  • Proficiency in English
  • Working knowledge of online platforms like WordPress and SEO concepts
  • Need to be aware of social media platforms and their algorithms

Followers: "Poppin Mathias, Sampath Mallikarjunan, Nishant Das, Nicholas D'Ascensao"
Description:
"About Flock
Flock is an enterprise messaging and collaboration app. At Flock we believe that synchronous messaging tools, supported with internal and external applications, have the power to smash organisational hierarchies, breakdown silos in the workplace, help companies better capture innovative ideas, support individuals in making faster decisions, and also bring a more personable communication style into the workplace.

With 30,000 businesses already using the platform we know that we are onto something big, and are now gearing up for a period of rapid growth. 

Flock is founded by Bhavin Turakhia. Serial entrepreneur and billionaire, Bhavin Turakhia is driven by a passion for problem-solving and maximizing efficiency through technology driven innovations. In the last 22 years, he has built 5 successful businesses, all driven by his belief that “it is our moral obligation to make an impact that is proportionate to our potential”. At 17, he co-founded Resellerclub, Logicboxes and BigRock, which he exited in a $160mn transaction in 2014. He is presently heading Flock - a suite of productivity apps, Zeta - a digital payments platform, and Radix - a leading registry for top-level extensions.

What is the Job like?
This is an exciting early stage sales role (although we have over 100,000 users and we’re growing fast, we only started our monetization journey less than a year ago!). Starting as an individual contributor hitting a quota role, the view is that the successful candidate will help us build and lead our a rapidly growing inside sales team within the calendar year. 
To start with, in addition to carrying an individual quota, you will be helping to design the systems and processes required for you to scale the mid-market team.  You will have lots of support with an Ops and Marketing team already in place; but at the same time you will have the space to make real mark on the shape of the organisation. 
"

ListContent1:
"
  • Full-cycle sales with responsibility from prospecting to close.
  • Assist with the building of systems and processes to support improvements in the sales team.
  • This is a rare opportunity where the individual would start off in the capacity of closing leads individually and in a short space of time have to build-out/lead a team of world class mid-market sales rep’s selling Flock's value proposition.
  • Deliver product demos, provide insightful technical answers, and recommend creative ways to get the most out of Flock for mid-market businesses
  • Work cross-functionally with enterprise business development, marketing, product Management and Support teams.
  • Be the voice of the customer to the product and marketing team
  • Find comfort in working in a fast-paced environment
  • Delight every prospective Flock user with each interaction and encourage them to move up from the freemium tier to power user to realise all of its benefits.
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent2:
"
  • 4-6 Years of demonstrable success as in an Inside Sales/team lead role
  • Experience building out sales processes (playbooks etc.) is a major plus
  • Experience in hiring and building successful teams
  • Prior experience at SaaS companies is a major plus
  • Sales experience in a freemium environment, not required, but a plus
  • Experience using CRM tools such as Hubspot and an avid user of productivity tools
"
ListContent3:
"
  • Process oriented: We are looking for an individual who is able to ID and build scalable sales processes. Identifying why/where we are winning is more important to us than just hitting quota.
  • Pioneer: You are likely to be the first sales hire in the US market - a lot of the basics won’t be in place. You need to relish the challenge!
  • New category: Enterprise communication tools are a relatively new category for the majority of the market. You need to enjoy selling the concept as much as you enjoy selling the actual product in order to be successful in this role
  • Team leadership: You should enjoy leading sales teams, as this is where we want you to be in the near-term!
"

Rated as a cool vendor in Unified Communications & Collaboration by Gartner, Flock is on a mission to increase productivity for teams and has been ranked as the #1 alternative to Slack by PCMag. As head of marketing you'll be uniquely positioned to drive growth for Flock to the next set of million users while building a truly global SaaS brand. ListTitle2: Characteristics
ListContent2:

  • Empathetic marketing thinker who understands what the customer needs and why.
  • Flair for ideating and building creative content
  • Natural collaborator and cross-functional executive.

ListContent3:
"

"

We at Directi love our jobs. And it’s no surprise – we get to work on exciting, new projects with some of the best brains in the industry, and that too in a vibrant atmosphere that is designed to be comfortable and conducive for our personal and professional growth.

ListContent1:
"
  • Drafting, Negotiating, Reviewing various contracts such as Product EULAs, software licensing including enterprise licensing agreement, Service agreements, Channel Partnerships, employment & labour contracts and more.
  • Reviewing and commenting on contracts received from third parties
  • Participating in negotiations on commercial contracts
  • Managing strategy and response to legal inquiries concerning business, product and vendors
  • Assisting legal strategy concerning potential legal risks or litigations surrounding commercial contracts
  • Liaison with external law firms as and when required
"
ListTitle2: Litigation
ListContent2:
• Strategizing and preparing detailed briefs showcasing our arguments in litigation related matters
  • Briefing external senior counsel for appellate or court proceedings
  • Attending and representing Directi in litigation matters
ListTitle3: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent3:
"
  • 6 - 8 years experience working in the legal/regulatory/compliance department of a top tier law firm specializing in tech
  • LLB / LLM degree from a top tier law school
  • Any additional IT degree / diploma or CS will be preferred
  • Excellent contract drafting skills, and experience in drafting contracts, terms, Licenses for IT Products, SAAS, Web services etc
  • Excellent management, organizational and communication skills
  • Strategic thought process and good judgment and ability to think creatively
  • Skills to analyze proposals, examine their legal & commercial consequences
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and command over language
  • Excellent negotiation skills
"

Description:
"Responsibilities:
·         Monitor the stability of our products with various internal tools. 
·         Ensure production servers are meeting the response SLA.
·         Scaling the production as per the demand.
·          Handle incident response, troubleshooting and fix for various product/services.
·          Handle escalations as per policies/procedures.
·         Get different internal/external groups together to resolve production site issues effectively.
·         Communicate clearly on tickets, phone calls made to the team about various issues.
·         Exhibit a sense of urgency to resolve issues.
·         Ensure SLA's and Operational standards are met.
·         Raise tickets to different internal groups to resolve recurrent problems, alerts and follow-up on escalated issues.
·         Liaison with engineering teams for RCA's(Root Cause Analysis), permanent resolutions on issues affecting production sites.
·         Contribute to Operations handbook.
·         Participate in Oncall rotation.
 
 
 
 
Skills:
 
You are acquainted with many of the below skills/tools –
 
·         Linux: Good understanding of Linux Systems.
·         Windows: Windows 2000/2003/2008
·         Scripting: Any of Bash/PERL/Ruby/Python/PHP
·         Fundamentals: Basic DNS & Networking, TCP/UDP, IP Routing, HA & Load Balancing Concepts
·         Application Protocols: SMTP,HTTP,FTP,IMAP,POP
 
Good to have –
·         Systems/Hardware: RAID, LOM/IPMI/IP KVMs, Dell Hardware
·         Windows: WMI, Powershell/VB scripts, MS-SQL Fundamentals
·         Applications: Postfix/Exim, Database Systems Fundamentals (MySQL/Postgres), Nginx, Apache, HAProxy, Tomcat
·         Tools/Utilities: Nagios, DHCP, Kickstart/Cobbler, Yum, RPM, GIT/SVN
·         Others: Regular expressions, Rescue Kits like TRK etc
"

Followers: "Nishant Das, Ninad Raval, Suman Prakash Das, Bhavin Turakhia, Poppin Mathias"
Description:
"About Flock
Flock is an enterprise messaging and collaboration app. At Flock we believe that synchronous messaging tools, supported with internal and external applications, have the power to smash organisational hierarchies, breakdown silos in the workplace, help companies better capture innovative ideas, support individuals in making faster decisions, and also bring more personable communication style into the workplace.
 
With 30,000 businesses already using the platform we know that we are onto something big, and are now gearing up for a period of rapid growth.

Flock is founded by Bhavin Turakhia. Serial entrepreneur and billionaire, Bhavin Turakhia is driven by a passion for problem-solving and maximizing efficiency through technology driven innovations. In the last 22 years, he has built 5 successful businesses, all driven by his belief that “it is our moral obligation to make an impact that is proportionate to our potential”. At 17, he co-founded Resellerclub, Logicboxes and BigRock, which he exited in a $160mn transaction in 2014. He is presently heading Flock - a suite of productivity apps, Zeta - a digital payments platform, and Radix - a leading registry for top-level extensions.

Role Overview
As a part of our Go to Market strategy - we have a unique distribution opportunity that gives us access to over 60 million users through large tech companies. We are looking for seasoned Product experts with a flair for Business Development and tech solutioning to drive partnerships with B2B tech companies.
"
Additional:
"Additional Resources
Recommended - Detailed Intro to Flock
Flock Intro video
Flock vs Slack video
About Flock’s Platform
Our Youtube Channel

Client Case Studies
How Ituran improved communication with Flock
How Dietitians on demand increased efficiency with Flock
How Hiyo created a virtual office for remote teams with Flock

Benefits and Perks
We at Flock love our jobs. And it’s no surprise – we get to work on exciting, new projects with some of the best brains in the industry, and that too in a vibrant atmosphere that is designed to be comfortable and conducive for our personal and professional growth.

And Flock goes the extra mile to make you feel at home. We offer benefits ranging from affordable catered meals and even snacks on the house. Our workspaces are welcoming and fun, complete with bean bag chairs and ping pong tables. You are free to wear what makes you comfortable and choose the hours you keep, as a team. Oh, and we’ve got your family covered too, with great health insurance plans and other benefits. In short, everything you need to be your best self at work!

We are passionate about helping teams move to the next level of communication and collaboration, and believe that happy employees are key to achieving this goal. If you like the idea of working on cutting-edge technologies and solutions that have a truly global impact, get in touch!
"
ListContent1:
"
  • Drive partnerships with B2B tech companies who in turn have 100k+ customers.
  • Represent Flock at multiple annual international industry events and identify new partnership opportunities.
  • Establish relationships with CEO/CTO/CMOs at these companies.
  • Manage Business Development cycles diligently and own the entire journey of prospecting, pitching, solutioning, closing and piloting.
  • Deeply understand partner offerings and business models to integrate and bundle Flock’s products with that of the Partner.
  • Suggest best practices and implementation model to partners to maximise value by adopting and offering various Flock suite products to their customers.
  • Craft personalized pitches, product demos and collateral.
  • Study and propose deep product integration opportunities with the partner to create an amazing experience for their customers and enable them improve metrics like revenue, customer engagement and retention.
  • Coordinate with product and tech teams to maintain customer momentum and resolving blockers.
  • Manage the post-sales relationship with customers to maximise value and uncover other strategic opportunities.
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent2:
"
  • You have 2+ years of product and/or engineering background and are good at solutioning.
  • You have 3+ years experience in customer facing roles - preferably as a Business Analyst or Business Development Manager - working with large companies on tech solutions.
  • You have experience in working with international partners or clients, preferably in North America or Europe.
  • You possess excellent analytical capabilities - can understand partners’ needs and possess a strong strategic mindset.
  • You are able to discuss technical requirements and solutions effectively to diverse stakeholder groups and to engage effectively with sr executives of large enterprises on both technical and non-technical matters.
  • You have outstanding business acumen and negotiation skills.
  • Your verbal and written communication and articulation skills are immaculate and you can always come up with the perfect text for any given interface.
  • You are a self-starter with demonstrated ability to manage complex dependencies.
  • You are a influencer and early adopter of all things tech.
  • You have some software development / coding experience [nice to have].
  • You are a natural conversationalist who makes for enjoyable company and is able to cut through social and cultural differences [nice to have].
"

Description:
"> About the Startup League

Powered by Radix, the Startup League is a unique initiative which rewards Radix’s most promising, early-stage startup clients. It is a program designed to provide a wide range of support to these startups through a bouquet of free goodies, marketing support and sponsorships to exhibit at startup and tech events.
 
Radix aims to build the Startup League as a strong community of credible startups that will be the face of the tech and startup industry tomorrow, thereby offering indirect exposure to its domains, and help make them the de facto choice for startups, globally. 
Since its inception in 2016, the Startup League has come to become a global community of 300+ startups, and is supported by 150+ ecosystem enablers, incubators, universities etc.

> What is the Job like?
We’re looking for an enthusiastic business and marketing intern who is entrepreneurial, creative, and likes a challenge. The Startup League is looking to enter Phase 2 of it’s lifecycle: grow and scale. As our summer intern, your job will be to build a product and chart a sustainable roadmap for this purpose. 
As part of your KRAs you will be expected:
 
·        Create strategies to make Radix TLDs the de-facto solution for startups globally
·        Identify potential markets and target audiences for the Startup League program.
·        Build on the existing program structure and create a holistic set of benefits for the way forward.
·        Create a concrete roadmap, and product specs for the new version of the program, which is viable and scalable to take the program from its current 300 members to the next 10,000
·        Work along with the team to fulfil any other project requirements.

> Who should apply for this role?

- You should have a passion for Strategy and Marketing. 
- You should possess strong marketing acumen
- You should have an appetite to take risks and work under stringent deadlines & constraints
- You should have strong written and communication skills
- You should be good at managing multiple activities & projects
- You should be go-getter and have a can-do attitude
- You should be a people's person and use the gift of gab to get out of tricky situations.
 
"

"As a TA Operations Associate, you will be supporting a team of seasoned Talent Scouts to help with managing the overall candidate experience along with building/ maintaining a complaint recruitment operations process. 
"
ListContent1:
"
  • Take full ownership of managing all offered candidates post offer acceptance.
  • Manage the pre- onboarding process for all offered candidates including but not limited to preparing offer letters, assisting them with documentation, coordinating with IT to set up systems, administering background checks and supporting HR Advisors with weekly inductions to ensure a positive onboarding experience.
  • To be the point of contact for all candidate inquiries on background verification, onboarding, travel coordination, offer letters etc.
  • Ensure compliance for every step in the recruitment operations lifecycle.
  • To be the perfect host to all our candidates starting from a vibrant hello to a warm good bye for all onsite interviews.
  • Ensure all background verification documents and approvals related to any employee case is properly sealed and audit ready.
  • Work with recruiters to maintain the recruitment database and generate reports for the team to identify shortcomings and suggest process recommendations to achieve operational excellence.
  • Keep challenging the status quo by re-thinking, re-building and re-initiating processes that need improvements and make them more effective & efficient.
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent2:
"
  • Graduate in any stream.
  • Has 0-3 years of experience in HR or Recruitment operations.
  • Should either be well versed with Excel or should have an incline to learn it.
  • Strong inclination towards attention to detail. So, obsession with perfection is always welcome.
  • Well-spoken and eloquent in emails.
  • Should understand how stressful a job hunt can be for a candidate and reflect the same in all communications that go out.
  • Flexible, fearless, and excited to build bigger and better processes for the team.
  • Knowledge of using MS Excel or zeal to learn and pick it up quickly.
"

ListContent1:
"
  • Own end-to-end execution, measurement, reporting and optimization of global paid search campaigns for Flock
  • Provide recommendations and execute strategies for keyword opportunities, campaign structuring, targeting across Search, and other facets of paid search in accordance with revenue goals.
  • Managing and maintaining large keyword lists. Keyword research and contextual understanding of what works and what doesn't in the US/UK/IN market is important.
  • Writing own Search Ad Copy and working with teams to build and optimize landing pages
  • Improve quality score of ads on google and optimize campaign structure
  • Running A/B tests across paid search campaigns & landing pages
  • Generate weekly and monthly reporting for all major metrics, goals tracking,revenue tracking, and other paid search initiatives.
  • Keep pace with search engine and PPC industry trends and developments.
  • Monitor and administer web analytics dashboards, reports and key reporting tools, and point out key areas of importance in accordance to internal revenue goals.
  • Monitor and evaluate search results and search performance across the major search channels.
  • Perform traffic and competitor analysis regularly to maintain an edge
  • Ability to plan, design, and execute paid social (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn)campaigns from execution to completion will be beneficial
  • Help marketing team with campaign trafficking, campaign launch, reporting, and analysis – Ability to build and track conversion funnels using internally developed dashboards as well as 3rd party tools
  • Optimize campaign performance towards acquisition, activation, retention, and reactivation goals.
  • Analyze & report on campaign KPIs to key stakeholders.
  • Partner with internal teams to optimize campaign performance (targeting, optimization, creative direction, etc.)
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent2:
"
  • Experienced Campaign Manager with atleast 3 years of experience executing & optimizing large scale Paid Digital Campaigns.
  • You must be willing to own end-to end set up, execution, measurement & optimization of paid search campaigns on Google & Bing
  • Proficient to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (pivot tables,VLOOKUP, & IF functions) & SQL
  • You know your way around: AdWords, Google Analytics, Google Optimize & Hubspot
  • Must have prior experience with copywriting for paid search and paid social ads
  • Knowledge of running PPC campaigns on Facebook, Linkedin & Twitter will be beneficial
  • Good to have - Knowledge of Facebook bidding, targeting, optimization, as well as web & app tracking setup and troubleshooting
  • Should Proactively communicate to team and management on project development, timelines, and results
  • Should be highly analytical, with the ability to analyse large amounts of data and draw actionable campaign insights.
  • Should have a disdain for the status quo; able to think and act outside the confines of the job description, desire to contribute value in other areas of growth 
"

ListContent1:
"
  • As an intern you will engage in product engineering efforts at Flock and work with world class dev teams to develop game-changing, globally distributed, Web 2.0 products used by millions worldwide.

  • You will be involved in the entire lifecycle of a project, including strategy, vision, design, UX, coding, architecture, deployment etc, and will be chiefly expected to deliver clean, testable and well-designed code for the same.
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this post?
ListContent2:
"
  • You have the makings of an ace developer - impressive problem solving skills, sharp reasoning and a logical bent. You are passionate about programming and delivering, clean, test-covered, well-designed, scalable code.
  • You have a good grasp on programming fundamentals including OOPs, Design Patterns, algorithms, data structures, networking etc and are not rigid with respect to choice of technology, are relatively platform agnostic, and open to adopting the right technology for the task at hand.

  • Skills –

  • You are acquainted with / have mastered _a few_ of the below skills/tools -
  • Java, C#, PHP, Ruby, Python, C++, Javascript, WPF, Erlang, Haskell, LISP, Linux, Flex, XUL, Bash, Advanced Networking, Async IO, Routing, TCP/UDP, Postgres, Data structures, Advanced RDBMS, MySQL, MSSQL, neo4j, BDB, REST, SOAP, IPC, RPC, HTML, CSS, Ajax, Agile, TDD, XP, Scrum, caching, Load Balancing, Horizontal Partitioning, memcached, Multi-threading, Concurrency, Scalability, Unicode, Usability / Ux, MVC, Spring, Titanium, Ant, Watir, Selenium, Git, CVS, SVN, JIRA, ... _ad infinitum_

Bonus points –

  • - Knowledge of Agile development methodologies (XP, Scrum etc)
  • - Active Blogger
  • - Contribution to Open Source projects
  • - You wrote your first program on a ZX Spectrum (Add extra points if you still own the wicked cool box)
  • - Ability to rattle off the names of every planet from Issac Asimov's Foundation
  • - Trilogy in reverse alphabetical order
"

ListContent1:
"
  • Communicate with customers in a friendly and professional manner and help them resolve any problems faced when using the product
  • Provide Omnichannel support over chat, email, phone and social media
  • Help fix any bugs that crop up in the product and contribute to the feature documentation
  • Work with our development team and suggest updates and features to continuously improve the customer experience
  • Ensuring speedy resolution of customer issues while maintaining high customer satisfaction
  • Participate in the product planning process to ensure that features requested by customers are prioritized and implemented
  • Strive to deliver a WOW! effect for our customers, to further enhance their perception of our product and company
  • Flexibility of working in shifts.
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent2:
"
  • B.Tech / BE Graduates
  • You are extremely passionate about technology - and can't live without your smartphone!You are well-versed with, and highly interested in, Internet and mobile communication
  • You have excellent written skills, and can explain concepts through clear and accurate writing
  • You have a way with people, and particularly good explanation skills
  • You think the Team’s victory is worth more than individual heroics
  • Ability to complete large volumes of work quickly and independently with a high level of drive, initiative and self-motivation
  • Most of all, you enjoy working in a fast paced and dynamic environment full of young, overachieving tech enthusiasts
"

Description:
"Flock is looking for a trainer who can conduct softskills, behavioural & sales training programs for employees. 
"
ListContent1:
"
  • Support business team in designing the training outline.
  • Conduct Training Need Analysis or customization study as required by the business unit. (if required)
  • Coordinate training schedule with the business locally and the training coordinator. 
  • Designing Modules/ content/quizzes with support from content team.
  • Responsible for Training Delivery.
  • Training Evaluation: Tests trainees to measure progress and to evaluate effectiveness of training.
  • Follow-up with Operations/Internal Stakeholders.
  • Analyzing performance metrics and planning for further training in collaboration with the Training Head.
  • Reports on progress of employees under guidance during training periods.
  • Conducts training sessions covering specified areas such as induction, on-the-job training, refresher training, and calendar programs etc.
  • Regularly updating training content in collaboration with the Content Head.
  • Reference to market need, designing new training modules and briefing the sales team.
"
ListTitle2: Competencies:
ListContent2:
• Strong Communication & Interpersonal Skills
  • Relationship & Stakeholder Management.
  • Excellent presentation skills.
  • Business Acumen.
  • Continuous Learning Attitude.
ListTitle3: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent3:
"
  • Should have 2 - 4 years of experience, with minimum 1 year in content development.
  • With MBA / PGDM Diploma. Degree is preferable    
  • Any reliable training certifications is an added advantage
  • Imparting training on soft skills, Sales and behavioral training.
  • Should have excellent communication skills.
  • Should be assertive, approachable and mature.
  • Task oriented and excellent team player.
  • Active, energetic & self-driven.
  • Should have the ability to deliver results and handle pressure.
  • Willing to travel anywhere in the country should the need arise.
  • Should be comfortable with MS- Power point, excel & spreadsheets.
"

Description:
"About the role
As a Front-end developer, you’ll be a part of the development team and a co-owner of CodeChef’s front-end. You’ll be expected to create, maintain and improve components of the website, both of the user-facing and in-house modules. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.

Responsibilities
- Convert the design into bug-free, clean functional screens using HTML/CSS & JS (along with any JS framework), with utmost care for aesthetics and responsiveness. We expect you to own modules end to end and take pride in the changes and UI that you ship
- Establishing a framework by taking care of reusability of the components you write
- Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
- Optimizing, cleaning, rewriting existing code
- Strategize front-end building process
- Mentoring interns and new team members
- Optimizing page speed and performance

What should you possess
- Ability to solve problems and implement the same in your workflow
- Ability to multi-task to manage workload with prioritization of tasks
- Consistency in deliverables with minimum supervision

Must have 
- Pixel Perfect conversion of design into code
- Building Responsive UI
- HTML5
- CSS3
- SASS
- Some JS framework
- Knowledge of a VCS
- Browser testing and debugging
- Knowledge of Adobe Illustrator

Good to have
- Knowledge of vanilla JavaScript
- Knowledge of ES6, OOJS, AJAX, JSON with REST APIs, NPM + Gulp
- Ability to produce semantic markup with BEM (Block element modifier) nomenclature
- Knowledge of making an application A11y friendly
- Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks like Ember.js, Vue.js, React.js or Angular (any)
- Understanding of graceful degradation and progressive enhancement
- Understanding of layout aesthetics and familiarity with Adobe suite and Sketch

Experience
- 2-5 years of hands-on industry experience of writing high performing applications

Annual Compensation 
- Rs. 4,00,000 - Rs. 7,00,000

Location
- Mumbai

"

At 17, he co-founded Resellerclub, Logicboxes and BigRock, which he exited in a $160mn transaction in 2014. He is presently heading Flock - a suite of productivity apps, Zeta - a digital payments platform, and Radix - a leading registry for top-level extensions.

Role Overview
We are looking for experienced Product Managers for Flock. In this role you will work closely with the Director, Product Management and the CEO and be responsible for various facets of the product management lifecycle of our products

ListContent1:
"
  • Contributing to product strategy and defining what we should build and why
  • Conducting research, performing measurements and determining the value of features in the pipeline to determine selection and prioritization
  • Coordinating with the user experience team and assisting in the creation of mocks, wireframes and prototypes
  • Implementing product analytics to derive behavioral insights on usage of each relevant feature
  • Reviewing product analytics to arrive at relevant business conclusions concerning various features
  • Growth hacking
  • Optimizing flows of features to increase completion rates
  • Interviewing users and gathering feedback
  • Competition review, comparison and analysis
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for these roles?
ListContent2:
"
  • You have 3+ years of experience as a Product Analyst / Product Manager or any similar profession
  • You have some software development / coding experience
  • You have outstanding business acumen
  • You have a good sense of User Experience and the ability to create, review and comment on mocks, wireframes
  • You are comfortable with creating UI prototypes and wireframes on paper, PowerPoint, Visio, Axure, Balsamiq etc.
  • Your oral and written communication and articulation skills are immaculate and you can always come up with the perfect text for any given interface

  • You are an avid user of various Web 2.0 products and sites
  • You have a keen interest in tracking the emerging trends and product offerings in the industry
  • You use analytics not only to drive decisions on what gets built but also to measure the effectiveness of new feature rollouts
  • You understand the nuances of integrating user interfaces into applications and have a decent knowledge of HTML, CSS, and Scripting
  • You also keep in touch with technology advancements and understand the impact of new standards on product design (for e.g. RIA or HTML 5.0)
"
ListContent3:
• You have spent at least 1-2 years writing software (preferably web applications) and subsequently switched to a techno-commercial discipline involving marketing
  • You have an MBA from a top tier B-school and an engineering degree (preferably in IT or Computer Science)

Followers: "Swarnendu Halder, Abhijeet Pandey, Anup Kalbalia, Kelly Pinto, Prerna Gera"
Description:
"About the role
CodeChef is seeking a Backend Engineer for a frenetic journey, who will be​ involved in all technical/engineering aspects related to the platform, playing a critical role in the design, planning, development, and deployment. We are looking for the one, who will help develop best practices for future development. The job offers the rare delight of owning the platform which is an integral part of the programming community.

Responsibilities
- Code, develop and design features 
- Deliver across the entire app life cycle, design, build, deploy, test and support
- Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
- Bug fixing, thwarting hackers
- Optimizations, scaling, performance enhancements
- Investigation of hard algorithmic problems (occasionally)

What should you possess:
- Good algorithmic problem-solving skills
- In-depth knowledge of any one programming language - Any, in-depth
- Exposure to any web technology. (PHP/Python/Ruby/Erlang etc)
- Academic/Industrial exposure to Computer Science. (Not having a professional computer science degree should not deter you from knowing the fundamentals)
- Understanding of Networking, Operating Systems, Databases
- Curiosity to work with front-end (JavaScript HTML & CSS) and appreciation for aesthetics. (We take pride in our software only if people can use it)

Good to have
- Insight into the inner workings of the Web. Hands-on with REST APIs / APIs, Proxies, HTTP, DNS, Queuing & Scheduling. 
- Experience in using *nix systems like GNU/Linux & Mac OS X. 
- Selected for GSoC, Participated, and won of any Hackathons 
- Running a deployed web/mobile 
- If you are a Free and Open Source Software contributor, do let us know. We value it.

An ideal team member has - 
- A strong desire to make a difference
- Love for technology and computer science education 
- A liking for what CodeChef does (each one of us here wholly believes in what we do, and see this not just as work but as an endeavor towards a common goal)
- Pursues excellence
- Driven by a desire to make an impact than by money. We do compensate our employees reasonably well, but this is not the highest paying job in the world. 

Perks 
- Delight of owning the platform for the programming community 
- An opportunity to make a difference. 

Experience
- Fresher 

Annual Salary Range 
- Rs. 8,00,000 (Fixed)

Location
- Mumbai

"

Followers: "Nishant Das, Ninad Raval, Deepak Rathod, Suman Prakash Das, Bhavin Turakhia"
Description:
"About Flock

Flock is an enterprise messaging and collaboration suite. At Flock we believe that synchronous messaging tools, supported with internal and external applications, have the power to smash organisational hierarchies, breakdown silos in the workplace, help companies better capture innovative ideas, support individuals in making faster decisions, and also bring a more personable communication style into the workplace.

With 30,000 businesses already using Flock we are onto something big, and are now gearing up for a period of rapid growth. This is where you come in..

Flock is founded by Bhavin Turakhia. Bhavin has also been the Founder / Co-Founder of Media.net, Directi, Radix, Ringo, Codechef and Zeta. These businesses comprise of 1500+ people, 8+ offices, 10+ million customers, revenues over $250+ million and a combined enterprise value of over $1.4 billion.

As a part of our Go to Market strategy - we have a unique distribution opportunity that gives us access to over 60 million users through large tech companies. We are looking for seasoned Product experts with a flair for Business Development and tech solutioning to drive partnerships with B2B tech companies.
"

ListContent1:
"
  • Drive partnerships with B2B tech companies who in turn have 100k+ customers.
  • Represent Flock at multiple annual international industry events and identify new partnership opportunities.
  • Establish relationships with CEO/CTO/CMOs at these companies.
  • Manage Business Development cycles diligently and own the entire journey of prospecting, pitching, solutioning, closing and piloting.
  • Deeply understand partner offerings and business models to integrate and bundle Flock’s products with that of the Partner.
  • Suggest best practices and implementation model to partners to maximise value by adopting and offering various Flock suite products to their customers.
  • Craft personalized pitches, product demos and collateral.
  • Study and propose deep product integration opportunities with the partner to create an amazing experience for their customers and enable them improve metrics like revenue, customer engagement and retention.
  • Coordinate with product and tech teams to maintain customer momentum and resolving blockers.
  • Manage the post-sales relationship with customers to maximise value and uncover other strategic opportunities.
"
ListTitle2: Who should apply for this role?
ListContent2:
"
  • You have 2+ years of product and/or engineering background and are good at solutioning.
  • You have 3+ years experience in customer facing roles - preferably as a Business Analyst or Business Development Manager - working with large companies on tech solutions.
  • You have experience in working with international partners or clients, preferably in North America or Europe.
  • You possess excellent analytical capabilities - can understand partners’ needs and possess a strong strategic mindset.
  • You are able to discuss technical requirements and solutions effectively to diverse stakeholder groups and to engage effectively with sr executives of large enterprises on both technical and non-technical matters.
  • You have outstanding business acumen and negotiation skills.
  • Your verbal and written communication and articulation skills are immaculate and you can always come up with the perfect text for any given interface.
  • You are a self-starter with demonstrated ability to manage complex dependencies.
  • You are a influencer and early adopter of all things tech.
  • You have some software development / coding experience [nice to have].
  • You are a natural conversationalist who makes for enjoyable company and is able to cut through social and cultural differences [nice to have].
"

Posting Title: Customer Support Associate - Turkish Language Expert
Description:
"We are looking for a Customer Support Associate , who will lead the Internationalization efforts for Flock in Turkey.

What is the Job like?
As a Customer Support Associate  you will be responsible for all of our customer communication - app and collateral - in your native language

Your responsibilities will include:

* Being the front line support for customers over chat, email for the native language
* Work with our development team and suggest updates and features to continuously improve the customer experience
* Ensuring speedy resolution of customer issues while maintaining high customer satisfaction
* Help fix any bugs that crop up in the product and contribute to the feature documentation
* Participate in the product planning process to ensure that features requested by customers are prioritized and implemented
* Strive to deliver a WOW! effect for our customers, to further enhance their perception of our product and company

Who should apply?
* You are extremely passionate about technology with a good understanding of IT vocabulary / Technical terms
* You have fluency in English & The Native Language and can explain concepts through clear and accurate writing
* A good understanding and in-depth knowledge of language/country-specific cultures
* Good oral communication skills
* Attention to detail combined with the ability to work quickly to meet deadlines
* You are pro-active and get stuff done
* You enjoy working with smart, fun people in a friendly, collaborative environment.

Educational Qualifications
* Graduate / Post Graduate from any stream (Language major is preferred)
"

Description:
"About Flock

Flock is an enterprise messaging and collaboration company. At Flock, we believe that messaging tools, combined with a cultural will, have the power to smash organizational hierarchies and break down silos in the workplace. Flock helps companies better capture innovative ideas, support individuals in making faster decisions, and also bring a more personable communication style into the workplace.

With 30,000 businesses already using our messaging platform, we know that we are onto something big, and are gearing up for a period of rapid growth.

Flock operates out of multiple offices across the globe, with our Marketing org based out of Mumbai in India and Boston, MA in the United States. We’re an international company built for a global audience. We’ve grown in leaps and bounds, and have grown the team 2x in the last two quarters alone.

Marketing at Flock is about communicating the value of team communication, and helping customers collaborate faster. We focus on creating awareness and making customers more productive, every day.

We're constantly looking for stellar people to work along with us. 

The Marketing org at Flock consists of the following teams:

- Performance Marketing: This team manages all paid marketing and demand generation efforts
- Organic Acquisition: This team undertakes a number of initiatives to improve Flock’s brand visibility and user acquisition across the internet through organic search, referrals and other non-paid marketing experiments
- Lifecycle Marketing: This team leads user communications - from external (email and push notifications) to internal, in-app communications. The team’s primary objective is to drive product adoption and ultimately drive higher user-to-customer conversion
- Content Strategy: This team is responsible for Flock’s overall content messaging strategy, which includes our blog, thought leadership content, web copy, co-marketing, social, and content distribution.
- Analytics & Ops: This team serves as the knowledge centre within the marketing organization, leveraging data, systems, and processes to ensure optimal program execution and measurement

If you're in any of the above roles we would love to explore the possibility of working together. 

Please go ahead and Apply! 
"

Followers: "Poppin Mathias, Ryan Kelly, Hema Negi, Lauren Kurkul"
Description:
"About Flock

Flock is an enterprise messaging and collaboration app. At Flock we believe that synchronous messaging tools, supported with internal and external applications, have the power to smash organisational hierarchies, breakdown silos in the workplace, help companies better capture innovative ideas, support individuals in making faster decisions, and also bring more personable communication style into the workplace.
 
With 30,000 businesses already using the platform we know that we are onto something big, and are now gearing up for a period of rapid growth

Flock is founded by Bhavin Turakhia. Serial entrepreneur and billionaire, Bhavin Turakhia is driven by a passion for problem-solving and maximizing efficiency through technology driven innovations. In the last 22 years, he has built 5 successful businesses, all driven by his belief that “it is our moral obligation to make an impact that is proportionate to our potential”. At 17, he co-founded Resellerclub, Logicboxes and BigRock, which he exited in a $160mn transaction in 2014. He is presently heading Flock - a suite of productivity apps, Zeta - a digital payments platform, and Radix - a leading registry for top-level extensions.
 
Role Overview
The Manager of Lifecycle Marketing will be responsible for driving key customer actions across the customer journey. This will be achieved by developing roadmaps based on customer insights and ensuring prioritization based on impact, executing across multiple channels.
 
The successful candidate is a seasoned marketer with experience in all aspects of customer lifecycle management including building cross channel initiatives, personalized trigger campaigns, and proper customer segmentation. Candidates will have experience working cross-functionally across internal and external teams, and driving programs that reach millions of users, as well as an aptitude for strong copywriting. A mind for innovation, putting thecustomer first, and learning through testing is also highly valued.
"
